metadata.title: YouTube Analytics for Beginners 2025: Getting Started Guide
metadata.description: Learn YouTube Analytics basics. Understand your data and grow your channel with insights.

hero.headline: YouTube Analytics for Beginners
hero.subheadline: Understand your channel data. Make better content decisions with analytics.

sections.content: YouTube Analytics tells you what's working and what isn't. But the dashboard can be overwhelming. Focus on the metrics that actually matter for growth. Here's a beginner's guide to understanding and using your YouTube data.

content.title: Views
content.description: How many times videos watched. Simple but important baseline metric.

content.title: Watch Time
content.description: Total minutes watched. YouTube's most important metric for recommendations.

content.title: Subscribers
content.description: Channel growth indicator. Track net gain/loss over time.

content.title: CTR (Click-Through Rate)
content.description: Impressions to views ratio. Measures thumbnail/title effectiveness.

content.title: Average View Duration
content.description: How long viewers watch. Indicates content quality.

content.title: Likes/Comments
content.description: Direct feedback. High engagement = interested audience.

sections.title: What to Look For
content: Where viewers drop off in videos

sections.title: Weekly Analytics Review
content: Check views and watch time trend

faq.question: Which metric matters most?
faq.answer: Watch time is YouTube's priority for recommendations. But CTR gets people to click first. Focus on both together.

faq.question: How often should I check analytics?
faq.answer: Weekly for trends, daily check for new uploads (first 48 hours matter). Don't obsess hourlyâ€”data needs time.

faq.question: Why are my views low?
faq.answer: Check CTR (thumbnail/title issue if low) and retention (content issue if low). Both need to be good for YouTube to recommend.

faq.question: What's Real-Time analytics?
faq.answer: Shows views in last 48 hours and 60 minutes. Useful for seeing new upload performance. Under 'Overview' tab.
